job_title: Housing Systems Navigator in Halifax, NS
pros:
Recruitment process pretty smooth
Great benefits
cons:
Low wage
Interview structure was questionable

pros: The frontline staff that you will work with might be amazing coworkers. Literally zero expectations on doing the job to any level of professional standards. The only one who holds you accountable to best practice, consistency of work, even just getting your notes done, will be you.
cons: Management is some of the worst in this field. Completely disconnected from the people they are supposed to be managing. Management spends most of its time doing trainings instead of managing their programs, All management positions are filled with very little diversity amongst the management staff. generally just the worst management I have ever experienced. Management literally stated "If you dont like it, Leave" while simultaneously saying that they want to work on retaining their staff teams. They provide lip service to staff complaints but institute NO CHANGE WHATSOEVER. If you have safety concerns when dealing with violent clients they will tell you to suck it up and that its part of the job. I cannot stress this enough either: THERE ARE NO ADVANCEMENT OPPORTUNITIES AVAILABLE. youd be looking at multiple years just to move into a team lead position, which is one step above bottom of the barrel there.

review_title: good first job but that’s it
pros: Good coworkers that support you even on your toughest days
cons: Management doesn’t really do what your coworkers do, if anything.

pros: Great co worker Paid time off

cons: Don't get paid enough for what you deal with
